intro: Eumachia obovoidea, commonly known as the broad-ovate eumachia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The plant's botanical features make it a valuable subject for ecological and taxonomic studies in its native habitat.
